data.title: Guide To Best 25 Delhi Markets With Their Closing Days In 2024
data.meta_description: Want to visit famous markets in Delhi? Check LBB's list of famous markets in Delhi, from Khan Market to Karol Bagh with their closing days, timings & more information!
data.text:
Nothing beats deciding to go shopping, getting ready, reaching there only to find that the market is closed! A heart-breaker for sure. So, we've decided to do the legwork and made a handy list of which Delhi markets are closed on what particular day, to help you plan in advance. So grab your shopping tote, cash and lots of water and get. Set.Shop!

Our favourite haunt on any given day, the place remains closed on Monday. Although, on the other hand, the best day to go is on Tuesday, since all the new stock comes in. If you do end up going on a Monday, you're sure to spot second-hand items for 20 bucks or less!

LBB Tip: Check out these online brands like Sarojini Nagar stalls!

Closed On: Monday

Nearest Metro Station: Sarojini Nagar Market on the pink line, and INA on the yellow line

Timings: 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM

Best Finds: Clothing, accessories and everything fashion

From Desi Vibes to Kaffiiaa to Barista, we are bowled over by Noida’s Sector 18 market. They have a lot of electronic stores and other pop-ups, which were typically closed on Tuesdays but switched to Sundays.

Closed on: Tuesday

Nearest Metro Station: The wave Noida sector 18 on the blue line

Timings: 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM

Best Finds: Clothing, accessories, utensils, electronics and lots more at pocket-friendly prices

One of the most fun markets to traverse is the Tibetan Market in Janpath where you'll spot great options for shoes, clothes, and home decor stuff too, but, unfortunately, you’ll find it shut on Sundays. Some of the restaurants in Connaught Place remain closed in the mornings with only a few opening up in the evenings, so if you have plans, call up the restaurants before visiting.

Closed on: Sunday

Nearest Metro Station: Janpath on the violet line

Timings: 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM

Best Finds: Statues, incense, shawls, paintings and Tibetan artefacts, including jewellery and semi-precious stones.

Chandni Chowk is one market where you can find everything, from fabrics and jewellery to stationery, spices and more. We particularly love the book bazaar on Nai Sadak! Also, do check out Chor Bazaar in the morning. Make sure to bargain and avoid going during the second half of the day to avoid the rush. Read everything about Chandni Chowk here.

Closed on: Sunday

Nearest Metro Station: Chandni Chowk, Chawri Bazar on the yellow line.

Pro-Tip: If you love silver jewellery, intricate jhumkis and the likes, check out these seven places to buy Indian jewellery online.

Timings: 11:00 AM to 7:00 PM

Khan Market, world's 20th most expensive retail location, is home to one of the finest brands. Everything from OGAAN to Amrapali, the stores are beautifully spread over the lanes of the market. Providing a mix of things. It is the perfect place for shopping after a quick brunch with your friends. Though the restaurants are usually open (yay! More Big Chill for us), you’ll find some of the smaller stalls and stores closed on Sunday.

Closed on: Sunday

Nearest Metro Station: Khan Market on the violet line

Timings: 10:00 AM to 12:00 AM

Best Finds: Cotton kurtas, accessories, phone covers and footwear along with designer wear

Our favourite when it comes to shopping on tiny student budgets, Kamla Nagar is the place where new restaurants on Hudson lane constantly pop up. For shopping you'll find a lot of stores with your shein, sarojini nagar style clothes (obviously catering to the students more) No point going here on a Monday, though—almost everything is closed.

Closed on: Monday

Nearest Metro Station: GTB Nagar on the yellow line

Timings: 10:00 AM to 10:00 PM

Best Finds: Popular fashion brands, reasonable clothes and spicy street food

GK II M block market, is always Bursting with restaurants, coffee and dessert hotspots, branded clothing stores and home decor stores, it definitely is one of the best markets to get all your needs fulfilled. From Iconic Nik Bakers where you can gobble up on some yum food, to Nalli's for silk sarees, you've got everything here.

Closed on: Tuesday

Nearest Metro Station: Greater Kailash on the magenta line, East Of Kailash on the violet line

Timings: Most of the stores close down around 7PM while the restaurants operate till late in the night. Do check out our hood guide here to know exactly where to go in the market.

Best Finds: Restaurants, coffee and dessert hotspots, branded clothing stores and home decor stores

This market is one disorganised Delhi shopping hubs, where you have to look closely for what you need, because there’s just so much to choose from! From clothing, accessories, footwear to fabrics, this place is a fashion enthusiasts haven!

Closed on: Wednesday

Nearest Metro Station: Paschim Vihar on the green line

LBB Tip: This market has a ton of awesome ethnic wear options but if you'd rather look online, check out our curation of the best ethnic wear labels.

Timings: 9:00 AM to 10:00 PM

Best Finds: Quality fabrics, affordable fast fashion clothes and anything fashion!

This is one of the oldest markets of the city that keeps us going back for the chaos, Punjabi tailoring shops and jewellery stores. Further down, you'll find Gaffar market has a bunch of imported goods to check out, especially thriving in all things electronic. Our Karol Bagh hood guide's here to help you navigate through the streets here FTW!

Closed on: Monday

Nearest Metro Station: Karol Bagh on the blue line

Timings: 10 AM to 10 PM

Best Finds: Jewellery, clothes, footwear, accessories and almost anything your shopaholic heart desires

Usually, Nehru Place is closed on Sundays, but you can find some loitering salesmen with cables, microphones, as well as some smaller shops that will sell you phone covers. The majority of the electronic work is stalled on Sunday. If you're someone who's looking for fabrics, this market also has some nice stores for that, also shut on Sundays.

Closed on: Sunday

Nearest Metro Station: Nehru Place on the violet line

Timings: 10 AM to 7 PM

Best Finds: Laptop, desktop, server, workstation, monitors, printers, projectors and almost anything related to electronics

While college students keep hanging out around the area even when it’s closed, if you’re looking for a grocery or fruit guy, they’ll probably be at home sleeping on a Tuesday. Do note that there's not much to do here except probably grab a bite to eat.

Closed on: Tuesday

Nearest Metro Station: Kailash Colony on the violet line

Timings: 10 AM to 9 PM

Best Finds: Cafes, restaurants and groceries

Asia’s largest place for salwars and suits, we keep going for the summery, vibrant prints and the shops full of fancy kolhapuris and flats. Not just that, Lajpat can be super economical when it comes to buying quality linen for your home. You’ll only find the churanwala and restaurants open in Lajpat Nagar on a Mondays though.

LBB Tip: Love juttis but too lazy to buy 'em from Lajpat? Hit up these online stores for affordable juttis and kohlapuris instead.

Closed on: Monday

Nearest Metro Station: Lajpat Nagar on the pink and violet line

Timings: 10 AM to 9 PM

Best Finds: Wedding couture, jewellery, street food, fast food, electronics and home decor.

This sweet little market has stayed put, irrespective of the number of malls that have come and gone. We love to talk about the new things that keep making their way here. But we suggest a day other than Tuesday to visit. you can get the whole scoop here, before visiting.

Closed on: Tuesday

Nearest Metro Station: Phase 1 on the rapid metro

Timings: 10 AM to 11 PM

Best Finds: Restaurants, cafes, fashion brands and salons

Planning to spruce up the house? A new couch, maybe? Well, you’ll get all of that and more (basically, everything related to furniture) at the Kirti Nagar furniture market. Don’t head there on a Monday, though. You’ll only find disappointment, not new furniture.

Closed on: Monday

Nearest Metro Station: Kirti Nagar on the green line

Timings: 11 AM to 8 PM

Best Finds: Beds, sofas, tables, chairs and anything related to woodwork or furnishings

The West Delhi hub for all things shopping, Rajouri Garden is a market full of pedestrians with a profusion of shopping bags in hand. There’s no point going there on a Monday—you’ll only find closed shutters and your shopping dreams shattered (not totally, though, some of the bigger stores might still be open.)

Closed on: Wednesday

Nearest Metro Station: Rajouri Garden on the blue line

LBB Tip: If you're on the look out for all things ethnic, then check this out.

Timings: 9 AM to 9 PM

Best Finds: Ethnic wear, unstitched suits, jewellery, street food, footwear and bakeries

If you’re feeling like diving into some jalebi, halwa, and other finger-licking street food, Chawri Bazaar is your respite. The market is also famous for its horde of wedding card printers, so if you’re a bride or groom to be, you might want to stay back and enjoy your Sunday elsewhere.

Closed on: Sunday

Nearest Metro Station: Chawri Bazar on the yellow line

Timings: 9 AM to 9 PM

Best Finds: Brass, copper, paper products and street food

Pack up fancy footwear and go with the rugged ones, please! Laxmi Nagar market is a crowded affair when it comes to street food and shopping. The East Delhi market has been undergoing a makeover with the likes of QD's opening up shop. You don’t want to go here on a Monday, though.

Closed on: Monday

Nearest metro Station: Patel Nagar on the blue line

Timings: 10 AM to 10 PM

Best Finds: Clothes, footwear, cosmetics, bags, accessories, and home decor items

The fancy buildings and the shimmery lights of South Ex market really make for a sight when you’re out there. You’ll find some amazing eateries if hunger pangs are starting to creep in. But if you’re planning on going for a shopping spree, you’d better avoid Mondays. The food joints remain open, though.

Closed on: Monday

Nearest Metro Station: South Extension on the pink line

Timings: 10 AM to 8:30 PM

Best Finds: Wedding couture, fashion brands, jewellery, street food and bespoke wear

When it comes to this little market, don’t be fooled by its size. You’ll find electronic stores, food havens (especially street food), repair centres, fabric stores and shopping joints—this market has it all.

LBB Tip: Try Peshawar’s aloo puri for a breakfast kick. The market does remain shut on Mondays, so make sure your plans are sorted.

Closed on: Mondays

Nearest Metro Station: Rajendra Place on the blue line

Timings: 10 AM to 10:30 PM

Best Finds: Street food, restaurants and repair centres

Noida’s Atta Market in Sector 27 is synonymous with affordability. And who doesn’t love affordable? Head here for a lot of women's wear including wedding and bridal, street-food, and the works!

LBB Tip: If you're looking to buy affordable women's wear then check this out.

Closed on: Wednesday

Nearest Metro Station: Noida Sector 18 on the blue line

Timings: 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM

Best Finds: Clothing, accessories, utensils, electronics and lots more!

Head over here for the best of the best second-hand, and first-hand furniture. If you're someone who loves to get their furniture customised, or made to your liking, this is the place to be! You'll also spot a ton of vintage knick knacks and mirrors here.

LBB Tip: Check this out to find out the best shops there

Closed on: Sunday

Nearest Metro Station: East of Kailash on the violet line

Timings: 10 AM to 7 PM

Best Finds: Wooden furniture and mirrors
